cab.content: (P 6282) From Viceroy, Foreign and Political Department, Qth October 1919.' (Received 9th,)No. 1407 S. Afghanistan. Our telegram of the 20th September, No. 1360 S. British Agent at Kabul has now arrived at Peshawar accompanied by Afghan Envoy. I am permitting Envoy to come to Simla because we regard it of paramount importance that we should keep in touch with Afghanistan and am sending reply of which following is summary : " Acknowledging receipt of Amir's letter to me enclosing a letter for King Emperor which has been forwarded to His Majesty. With' regard to reference in AnuYs letter to memoranda regarding Afghan desire handed by Ali Ahmed to Grant, I am informing Amir that British Government must await proof of friendly sentiments towards itself before consenting to resumption of discussions with the object of permanent establishment of friendship and I called his attention to the memoranda presented by Grant on this subject."
